timeline.message: Miscellaneous small perf investigations in azure-core in draft form.
Fix some checkstyle issues and a test failure.
Compile two frequently parsed regex's into a Pattern to save CPU time
Hack in some code that tries to minimise the amount of times we serialize / deserialize to / from String, instead trying to use byte[] for input and ByteArrayOutputStream for output.

timeline.bodyText: This method appears to only be used in tests and in one case where we check if a status code is valid. Thoughts on removing this method since it is non-public API and making callers of this use the boolean isExpectedResponseStatusCode(int statusCode) method? This will be more performant as we can completely remove the int[] cloning.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: The only caller to this is HttpResponseBodyDecoder.isErrorStatus
replies.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: This is unfortunately public API, otherwise I would have done what you suggested. I rearranged the code internally so that the only things calling this code is test code, which is why I pay the price for int[] cloning here, rather than in the constructor.
replies.author: JonathanGiles

replies.bodyText: My mistake - SwaggerMethodParser is itself a non-public class. I will revise the code.
replies.author: JonathanGiles

timeline.bodyText: This interface is in implementation, so we should be able to remove it completely.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -59,11 +59,24 @@ default Type getHeadersType() {
      * 2. If the returned int[] is not-null, only the codes in the array are considered as success code.
      *
      * @return the expected HTTP response status codes
+     * @deprecated Use {@link #isExpectedResponseStatusCode(int)} instead.
      */
+    @Deprecated // This is only used in tests now - all uses should go via isExpectedResponseStatusCode instead

timeline.bodyText:
In implementation so I don't think we need a default. If we want to keep a default we should check is the status code is in the 200 range.
return (statusCode / 100) == 2;
timeline.author: alzimmermsft
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -59,11 +59,24 @@ default Type getHeadersType() {
      * 2. If the returned int[] is not-null, only the codes in the array are considered as success code.
      *
      * @return the expected HTTP response status codes
+     * @deprecated Use {@link #isExpectedResponseStatusCode(int)} instead.
      */
+    @Deprecated // This is only used in tests now - all uses should go via isExpectedResponseStatusCode instead
     default int[] getExpectedStatusCodes() {
         return null;
     }
 
+    /**
+     * This method returns {@code true} if the given {@code statusCode} is in the list of expected HTTP resposne
+     * codes returned by {@link #getExpectedStatusCodes()}, {@code false} otherwise.
+     *
+     * @param statusCode The HTTP response status code to evaluate.
+     * @return {@code true} if the given status code is expected.
+     */
+    default boolean isExpectedResponseStatusCode(int statusCode) {

replies.bodyText: I agree - I thought this was public API so I added it, but I have now removed it again.
replies.author: JonathanGiles

timeline.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText: Mind adding more Javadocs to this, having break labels isn't very common.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText: We want to use WeakHashMap to evict from the cache once the Type key becomes null/garbage collected right?
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: I've changed it to be a HashMap.
replies.author: JonathanGiles

timeline.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText: This is an API breaking change.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: It's now called deserializeFromBytes in more recent commits.
replies.author: JonathanGiles

timeline.message: Add afterburner module to xml mapper
Reuse same Jackson ObjectMappers for all swagger interface methods in a single RestProxy instance
Improve code that enables object mapper reuse
Remove references to jsonwrapper in module-info.java
Rename one newly introduced SerializerAdapter method to avoid incompatibilities.
Some code cleanups based on review feedback
Update code paths that were creating unnecessary container types
Merge setScheme and setHost into a single API
Change interface defaults to fix ServiceBus test issues

timeline.bodyText:
String.split(.) internally uses java regex which is CPU expensive.
Please ensure regex is not used:
https://www.baeldung.com/java-string-performance#split
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: I looked into this when I was reviewing the code, String.split has a fast-path for single-char 'regexes' which this goes through. You can see the fast path in the JDK here: http://hg.openjdk.java.net/jdk8/jdk8/jdk/file/687fd7c7986d/src/share/classes/java/lang/String.java#l2317
replies.author: JonathanGiles

replies.bodyText: Thank you @JonathanGiles I learnt something today.
replies.author: moderakh

timeline.message: Merge in upstream and change APIs from byte[] to InputStream/OutputStream
Remove AfterBurner dependency from Azure Core
Fixed Tables tests by updating its SerializerAdapter implementation
Update usage of String based serialization to OutputStream based, added new internal type of AccessibleByteArrayOutputStream
Update serializeRaw to use OutputStream serializer method
Fix Form Recognizer tests that were failing

timeline.bodyText:
There might be a potential concurrency issue here on the static Map.
We had a possible one on this line in UrlBuilder.parse (under Java 8)
PARSED_URLS.put(url, ub);

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15213781/92462976-c574af80-f1fd-11ea-8f19-33e0919913a5.png
timeline.author: weidongxu-microsoft
